titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1215, PROTECTING ACCESS TO CARE ACT OF 2017

name.namePart: Committee on Education and the Workforce

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1215, PROTECTING ACCESS TO CARE ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 110

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Protecting Access to Care Act of 2017_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 382, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1215) to improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system, by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 186 noes, Roll No. 326, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 184 nays, Roll No. 325.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Protecting Access to Care Act of 2017_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 382, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1215) to improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system, by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 186 noes, Roll No. 326, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 184 nays, Roll No. 325.

extension.searchTitle: REAFFIRMING THE COMMITMENT OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE NORTH ATLANTIC TREATY ORGANIZATION'S PRINCIPLE OF COLLECTIVE DEFENSE; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 110

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Solemnly reaffirming the commitment of the United States to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's principle of collective defense as enumerated in Article 5 of the North Atlantic Treaty
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Res. 397, solemnly reaffirming the commitment of the United States to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's principle of collective defense as enumerated in Article 5 of the North Atlantic Treaty, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 423 yeas to 4 nays, Roll No. 328; and

titleInfo.title: SANTA ANA RIVER WASH PLAN LAND EXCHANGE ACT

extension.searchTitle: SANTA ANA RIVER WASH PLAN LAND EXCHANGE ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 110

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Santa Ana River Wash Plan Land Exchange Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 497, amended, to direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey certain public lands in San Bernardino County, California, to the San Bernardino Valley Water Conservation District, and to accept in return certain exchanged non-public lands, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 424 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 329;

congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Authorizing the expansion of an existing hydroelectric project
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 220, amended, to authorize the expansion of an existing hydroelectric project, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 424 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 330;
